![Geumsan Park (Nabeup Forest Path) (금산공원 (납읍난대림지대))](/2022-07-20-1658284832645/218738_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Geumsan Park is a dense evergreen forest near the village in Aeweol-eup, Jeju-si. The forest is the sole evergreen forest remaining in the flatlands of western Jeju, and is home to tall evergreens and 60 species of warm temperate plants. The forest has been designated as a sample region for providing basic natural materials to help develop original vegetation as an academic resource. It has been officially designated as a Natural Monument, and is protected according to the Cultural Properties Protection Law. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|• 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
• Jeju Travel Hotline: +82-64-740-6000| |parking:|Not available| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Available Facilities:|Walking path, nature observation center, etc.| |Restrooms:|Available| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-20-1658284832645/218739_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-20-1658284832645/218739_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513600_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513600_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513602_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513602_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513605_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513605_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513607_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513607_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513609_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513609_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513611_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513611_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513613_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513613_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513615_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513615_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513617_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-20-1658284832645/2513617_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [☎️+82-64-740-6000](tel:+82647406000) - [🏠www.visitjeju.net](http://www.visitjeju.net/) ```googleMap latitude: 33.4338956949 longitude: 126.3307108375 title: Nabeup-ri, Jeju-si, Jeju-do ``` ## Directions [Taxi]
Approx. 35 min. from Jeju International Airport.

data.title: Geumsan Park (Nabeup Forest Path) (금산공원 (납읍난대림지대))
data.description: Geumsan Park is a dense evergreen forest near the village in Aeweol-eup, Jeju-si. The forest is the sole evergreen forest remaining in the flatlands of western Jeju, and is home to tall evergreens and 60 species of warm temperate plants. The forest has been designated as a sample region for providing basic natural materials to help develop original vegetation as an academic resource. It has been officially designated as a Natural Monument, and is protected according to the Cultural Properties Protection Law.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gueom Port (구엄포구)
dataList.description: Near Aewol's coastal road, a beautiful sunset spot, there is the small and quaint Gueom Port. Next to the port, there is a rock saltern. This is where salt was produced on top of the basalt. The beautiful coastal road along the rock saltern was designated as a coastal path. There is also a small lighthouse for fishermen returning from sea at night.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gosalli Forest Trail (고살리 숲길)
dataList.description: The Gosalli Forest Trail runs along a stream in Harye 2-ri, Namwon-eup on the southern part of Jeju Island. The area was recognized by the Ministry of Environment in 2013 for their outstanding efforts in preserving and protecting the local ecology. The forest trail passes through one of Jeju's beautiful forested areas, and is perfect for peaceful leisure walks, being less known among tourists. To limit the amount of damage to the natural environment, the trails are unrefined, so guests are reminded to tread carefully.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gimnyeongsagul Cave [UNESCO World Heritage] (김녕사굴 [유네스코 세계자연유산])
dataList.description: Gimnyeongsagul Cave is located close to Manjanggul Cave in the northeastern part of Jeju Island. The name of the cave, "Sagul," comes from the snake-like formation of the cave ("sa" meaning serpent). The entrance of the cave is wide like a serpent holding its mouth wide open, but once inside, the tunnel narrows resembling the body of a snake. Gimnyeongsagul Cave is a highly protected area and has been designated as Natural Monument No. 98 along with Manjanggul Cave.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gimnyeong Seongsegi Beach (김녕성세기해변 (김녕해수욕장))
dataList.description: The clear waters that are highlighted with cobalt-blue and the clean white sand of Gimnyeong Seongsegi Beach steal the hearts of visitors every year. The beach is also popular with fishermen, who enjoy rope fishing from the rocks. This area is known to be good for catching striped beakfish and spotty belly greenlings. Not far from the beach is Manjanggul Cave, which offers a welcome escape from the daytime heat.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Geomunoreum Lava Tube [UNESCO World Natural Heritage Site] (거문오름 [유네스코 세계자연유산])
dataList.description:
Geomunoreum Lava Tube System is a series of lava tubes that originated from the eruption of Geomunoreum, a parasatic cone. Geomunoreum has an altitude of 456 meters and with lava tubes spreading out in a streamlined shape, its lava tube system is the largest of its kind on Jeju Island. The name is said to have originated when the local islanders called the cone "Geomun," which is translated to “black,” referring to the dense forest formed on the crater. However, according to researchers and linguists, the term "Geomun" may have originated from a word from the Gojoseon period which were used to refer to deities, inferring that the name Geomunoreum actually means "holy hill."

Geomunoreum Lava Tube System consists of roughly 20 lava tubes that follow the cone's slope to the northeast, stretching out all the way to the shore. Among these tubes, Bwengdwigul, Mangjanggul, Gimnyeonggul, Yongcheondonggul, and Dangcheondonggul Caves are inscribed as a UNESCO World Natural Heritage.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Geommeolle Beach (검멀레해변)
dataList.description: Under Udobong Peak is Geommeolle Beach, a very small beach, reaching only about 100 meters in total length, with a name literally translating to "black sand" in the Jeju dialect. Visitors can enjoy a beautiful sunrise, peaceful beach and the cool ocean water in the cave at the end of the beach.
dataList.author: korea-tour
